channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Moldova’s pro-Western president wins vote overshadowed by Russian meddling claims
item.description: Moldova’s pro-Western President Maia Sandu has won a second term in a pivotal presidential runoff against a Russia-friendly opponent, in a race that was overshadowed by claims of Russian interference.
item.content:encoded:
Moldova’s pro-Western President Maia Sandu has won a second term in a pivotal presidential runoff against a Russia-friendly opponent, in a race that was overshadowed by claims of Russian interference.

(Image credit: Vadim Ghirda)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Anxious at the Portland airport? Beni the Llama is here for you, spreading joy
item.description: The gentle animals are part of Portland International Airport's effort to counter travel stress with soothing elements from nature.
item.content:encoded:
The gentle animals are part of Portland International Airport's effort to counter travel stress with soothing elements from nature.

(Image credit: Jay Fram for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: A stranger's words have a ripple effect on one man's life
item.description: After Brian Perkins refused a stranger's help, her actions changed his life forever.
item.content:encoded:
After Brian Perkins refused a stranger's help, her actions changed his life forever.

(Image credit: Brian Perkins)
item.dc:creator: Autumn Barnes

item.title: Trump and Harris are in Reading, Pa., today, thanks to a bad joke about Puerto Rico
item.description: The candidates are both spending time on the last day of the campaign in Reading — a majority-Latino city — where that bad joke about Puerto Rico has resonated.
item.content:encoded:
The candidates are both spending time on the last day of the campaign in Reading — a majority-Latino city — where that bad joke about Puerto Rico has resonated.

(Image credit: Carmen Russell-Sluchansky)
item.dc:creator: Carmen Russell-Sluchansky

item.title: The race for the Senate: Here are the top races to watch
item.description: Republicans are favored to take control of the chamber thanks to a 2024 map of races that tilts disproportionately in the GOP’s favor. Here are the races to watch.
item.content:encoded:
Republicans are favored to take control of the chamber thanks to a 2024 map of races that tilts disproportionately in the GOP’s favor. Here are the races to watch.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Susan Davis

item.title: 'Traitors within': How one group tried to radicalize the American right in the '60s
item.description: In today’s political climate, conspiracy theories are commonplace. But they’re nothing new. In the 1960s, the John Birch Society built a movement around them.
item.content:encoded:
In today’s political climate, conspiracy theories are commonplace. But they’re nothing new. In the 1960s, the John Birch Society built a movement around them.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Nellie Gilles

item.title: Meet the conservative women who are keeping their votes for Kamala Harris a secret
item.description: Polls show a historic gender gap in the 2024 election. Democrats are reminding conservative women: votes are a secret and they can vote for who they want, including Vice President Harris.
item.content:encoded:
Polls show a historic gender gap in the 2024 election. Democrats are reminding conservative women: votes are a secret and they can vote for who they want, including Vice President Harris.

(Image credit: Hannah Beier)
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: Near the front line of the Russia-Ukraine war, Ukrainians are bracing for the U.S. election
item.description: In Ukraine’s industrial east, near the front line in the almost 3-year-old war with Russia, Ukrainians are bracing for a U.S. election they fear will have major repercussions for their country.
item.content:encoded:
In Ukraine’s industrial east, near the front line in the almost 3-year-old war with Russia, Ukrainians are bracing for a U.S. election they fear will have major repercussions for their country.

(Image credit: Michael Robinson Chávez for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: Quincy Jones, pop mastermind and 'Thriller' producer, dies At 91
item.description: The production wizard behind Michael Jackson's Thriller won 28 Grammy awards during a career that spanned more than 70 years as a performer, songwriter, producer and music executive.
item.content:encoded:
The production wizard behind Michael Jackson's Thriller won 28 Grammy awards during a career that spanned more than 70 years as a performer, songwriter, producer and music executive.

(Image credit: Chris Delmas)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Thompson

item.title: Thousands of children in Gaza receive 2nd dose of polio vaccine, with others cut off
item.description: Health workers say they won't be able to vaccinate all the children they had planned to reach because of ongoing fighting.
item.content:encoded:
Health workers say they won't be able to vaccinate all the children they had planned to reach because of ongoing fighting.

(Image credit: Omar Al-Qattaa)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim
